alert.note: Alert for Garden; Grant; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 1:43AM CDT until July 07 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Garden County in the panhandle of Nebraska... Southern Sheridan County in the panhandle of Nebraska... Western Grant County in west central Nebraska... * Until 645 AM MDT Thursday. * At 1243 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ellsworth, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Antioch, Lisco, Ashby, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Mumper, Adams Flats, Jerry Lake, Rackett, Wild Horse Flats, Dogtown Flats, Patterson Lake, Herman Lake, Tralnor Lake, Kincaid Lake, Sugar Loaf Hill, Richardson Lake and Lakeside. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 139. Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 5. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
